info.title: Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &smlm;

abstract.para: This guide explains how to register and update &rhel; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &smlm;.
To register with &rmt;, see Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &rmt;.

To register CentOS &productnumber; directly with the &scc;, see
Registering CentOS Linux &productnumber; with the &scc;.

info.meta: How to use &productname; and &smlm; to update &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber;.
Use &smlm; to update &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber;.

revdescription.para: Changed SUSE Manager to SUSE Multi-Linux Manager where applicable
Direct SCC registration guide is now available
HA repositories are now available with LTSS
Changed SUSE Liberty Linux to SUSE Multi-Linux Support where applicable
RMT is now available with all subscription levels

section.title: Deploying &smlm;
section.para:
See the following guide to install &smlm;:
&smlm; Installation and Upgrade Guide.

You can use most &productname; subscriptions to register this machine. However, the Lite subscription only includes an entitlement for &rmt;, so if you want to use &smlm; instead you will need a separate &smlm; subscription.

tip.title: Other installation options
tip.para:
To deploy &smlm; in the public cloud, see
&smlm; Public Cloud Guide.

section.title: Registering &rhla; or CentOS Linux with &smlm;

important.title: New repositories for &productname; &productnumber; LTSS
important.para: The repository structure has changed in &productname; &productnumber; LTSS. If you previously registered your system with a general &productname; subscription, follow the Client Configuration Guide again to add and synchronize the LTSS repositories.

To clean up the old repositories, see
&smlm; Administration Guide: Remove Channels.
